input_text.Prompt:
SACRAMENTO, Calif. (AP) — Legislation advancing in California would require short-term rental housing websites including Airbnb to warn users they may be violating their leases.

The Assembly on Thursday unanimously approved SB761 by Democratic Sen. Isadore Hall of Compton with 73 votes.

The bill is sponsored by the California Apartment Association, which says vacation rentals put other tenants in danger by bringing unscreened people into complexes.

Advertisement

SB761 requires Airbnb-type websites to have notices saying room listings may put tenants at risk of legal action or eviction. Some San Francisco tenants have received eviction notices for violating prohibitions on short-term renting.

Airbnb's terms and conditions already tell hosts to check their leases, but they don't mention evictions.

The bill returns to the Senate for a vote on amendments added for Airbnb to drop its opposition.

Generate a summary:
input_text.Response A:
Sure! Here is a summary of the article written in a way that is easy to understand for a child.

There's a new law that could happen in California! It would make Airbnb tell people that they might get in trouble if they rent out their apartments on Airbnb. Some people are worried that having strangers come into their building can be dangerous. Airbnb already tells people to check their leases, but they don't say anything about getting kicked out. The law needs to go back to the Senate one more time to be final.
input_text.Response B: A new bill has been introduced in the California state assembly that would require short-term rental websites, such as Airbnb, to warn users that they may be violating their leases. The bill, SB761, is sponsored by the California Apartment Association, which has stated that vacation rentals put other tenants at risk by bringing unscreened people into complexes. The bill requires Airbnb-type websites to have notices saying that room listings may put tenants at risk of legal action or eviction. Airbnb's terms and conditions already tell hosts to check their leases, but they do not mention evictions. The bill will return to the Senate for a vote on amendments added for Airbnb to drop its opposition.

input_meta.preamble_a: Respond using only short words and simple language, as if you were talking to a child.
input_meta.preamble_b: Respond using complex language, long words and technical terms, as if you are an expert.

label_annotations.feedback: Response A did not correctly follow the prompt, but that is captured in its complexity rating. Neither were all that persuasive (or not) as they were just summarizing an article.
